result.execSummary:
The defendant WILLIAM D LOFTON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office immediately. Failure to do so shall result in a Judgment being placed against the Defendant for any outstanding amount.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and fingerprints and photograph pursuant to Wis. Stats. 970.02(7).  IMMEDIATELY following court, contact (920) 236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  Arrangements to complete collection shall be made within 72 hours.  At time of appointment, Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. WILLIAM D LOFTON

records.addlTxt: 8:39 AM Defendant WILLIAM D LOFTON appeared by video.  Attorney Michael Lim in court for WILLIAM D LOFTON.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Nash in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Stipulation entered onto court record = plea to all 3 counts, State recommends 24 months of probation with expungement.  Defense argues for 12 - 18 month term of probation with expungement.    Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.
Original Bench Warrant returned from Winnebago County Sheriff's Office.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Warrant Recall and Cancellation Notice -- Authorization to Appear was on file by Atty Lim.  Request to reinstate the 11/1/22 hearing date.
Authorization to Appear was on file.
forwarded to Winnebago County Sheriff's Office - Warrants Division to process by JA.

8:35 AM  Defendant WILLIAM D LOFTON not in court.  Attorney Daniel Muza appears for Attorney Michael Lim in court for WILLIAM D LOFTON.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie Ann Stauber Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Failure to appear by DEF for a known hearing.  Court authorizes issuance of a bench warrant.

1:42 PM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Jeanne Struve in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant WILLIAM D LOFTON not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Michael Lim in court for WILLIAM D LOFTON.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading.  Noting a special appearance and enters a not guilty plea.  Court notes victim's rights are complied with.  Court orders bond to continue. Attorney Lim was just appointed - authorization for appearance to be filed within 10 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

RECEIVING OR CONCEALING STOLEN PROPERTY, CCW, POSS OF THC
CONDITIONS: No contact with V1 in Milwaukee PD report # 22-1780038.Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are. Absolute sobriety. No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

2:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant WILLIAM D LOFTON appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein & Intern Cunningham appeared by video for WILLIAM D LOFTON. Given/has complaint. Waive reading. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Record closed @ 2:56.
faxed to Sheriff's Office for handout to DE with their copy of the criminal complaint.
